Define a species

Source: R/species_define.R
species_define.Rd

Creates a list with taxonomic/identifying information and parameters for mean and standard deviation of body mass.

species_define(
  aou = NA,
  genus = NA,
  species = NA,
  mean_size = NA,
  sd_size = NA,
  sim_species_id = 1
)

Arguments

aou

AOU
genus

genus
species

species
mean_size

mean body size
sd_size

sd of body size
sim_species_id

identifier; if using taxonomic info, defaults to AOU. If not, defaults to 1. Supplying other values can be useful for simulation models.

Value

list with species parameter information

Details

The identifying information used depends on which parameters are provided, with the following order of preference: AOU > genus + species > user provided mean and sd > user provided mean and estimated sd.

Examples

species_define(aou = 2881)

#> $aou
#> [1] 2881
#> 
#> $genus
#> [1] "Perdix"
#> 
#> $species
#> [1] "perdix"
#> 
#> $mean_size
#> [1] 405.5
#> 
#> $sd_size
#> [1] 31
#> 
#> $sd_method
#> [1] "AOU lookup"
#> 
#> $sim_species_id
#> [1] 2881
#> 
species_define(genus = "Perdix", species = "perdix")

#> $aou
#> [1] 2881
#> 
#> $genus
#> [1] "Perdix"
#> 
#> $species
#> [1] "perdix"
#> 
#> $mean_size
#> [1] 405.5
#> 
#> $sd_size
#> [1] 31
#> 
#> $sd_method
#> [1] "Scientific name lookup"
#> 
#> $sim_species_id
#> [1] 2881
#> 
species_define(mean_size = 400, sd_size = 30)

#> $aou
#> [1] NA
#> 
#> $genus
#> [1] NA
#> 
#> $species
#> [1] NA
#> 
#> $mean_size
#> [1] 400
#> 
#> $sd_size
#> [1] 30
#> 
#> $sd_method
#> [1] "Mean and SD provided"
#> 
#> $sim_species_id
#> [1] 1
#> 
species_define(mean_size = 400)

#> $aou
#> [1] NA
#> 
#> $genus
#> [1] NA
#> 
#> $species
#> [1] NA
#> 
#> $mean_size
#> [1] 400
#> 
#> $sd_size
#> [1] 28.55916
#> 
#> $sd_method
#> [1] "SD estimated from mean"
#> 
#> $sim_species_id
#> [1] 1
#>
